website_summaries.verdict: A good buy if you want a reliable all-in-one printer. Choose it if you want a middle-of-the-road printer, but beware of some design flaws that may cause it it jam.
pros: Easy to install and set up WiFi
cons: Tends to jam a bit more than usual
Design is a bit bulky compared to other models

customer_reviews.title: Not my Jam.  Super slow. Jams after every page. No Airprint. Basically an ugly paperweight.
customer_reviews.text: Printing is SUPER SUPER slow. It takes almost a full minute to print a simple black and white page. And after every page it printed it shows a "printer error" saying it has a paper jam which it did not. You have to power it off and back on to clear it. Its the Dial-Up of printers. Airprint didn't work. You have to hook into your existing WiFi. Expectation were super low because of the price and it still managed to disappoint. My kids can finger paint a better copy and WAY faster. And no printer cable so you're stuck with SUPER slow "WiFi" connection...
customer_reviews.author: B.K. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up on wifi and to work
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up on wifi and to work. No problem printing from computer/laptop and we can also print from the kindles. Took me a bit to find a print app that worked and it's still a little "clumsy" but my mother can now print coupons n recipes from her kindle. Check out Hammermill print app for the android devices. I'm happy with the color printing of pictures I need but haven't priced out ink yet. I don't normally print photos because it's just cheaper to go to snapfish so this is just for quick prints. Great price and happy with it too...can't ask for much more.
customer_reviews.author: S. Beck

customer_reviews.title: I love the printer my issue is the extra ink the ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the printer my issue is the extra ink the I purchased at the same time as the printer ,same time advertise as brought at same time went to replace the cartage and it does not fit the printer so why advertise it together now its to late to return it and its a box of 28 cartridges and I have no ink false advertisement is my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Lelah W.

customer_reviews.title: I did not like this printer. Complicated set up and wifi printing never worked
customer_reviews.text: This printer wants to install lots of junk on your desktop. Scans items to your "pictures" folder even if they are pdf documents. Doesn't do the wifi printing at all. Overall a huge disappointment so I returned it. I would not recommend this printer at all. It took me hours to set it up and it never worked for either wifi, google or AirPrint. Only printed with the cable connected and opened a bunch of menus on the desktop just to print something simple.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Paper jams ALL THE TIME!
customer_reviews.text: Paper jams all the time. I have tried repeatedly to make it print like a normal printer, but you literally have to baby the pages one by one by hand, and then it will jam at a moment's notice. DO NOT BUY! Also, it's not covered under the normal Prime 90 day return window, and I'm waiting to hear back from the vendor to see if they'll take a return. I'm not holding my breath, don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: DivaJadelyn

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Buggy
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a little while and if it weren't for the fact that I had purchased so much ink, I would have tossed it out the window. There are constant issues with printing - not the ink cartridges I use. Constantly requires me to shut down and restart. It says I have to disconnect from power. Print quality isn't bad but such a waste of time using this thing. Too many options to go with something like this.
customer_reviews.author: lila

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! I’ve owned this printer for one ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! I’ve owned this printer for one year. Have used it maybe 20 times, for only a few pages at a time. The ink cartridges have needed to be replaced twice in that time ($60 each time). After replacing the primary black cartridge recently with a genuine Canon cartridge, it will no longer print black and white. Tried a second new cartridge and it still won’t work. Have cleaned the nozzles, reset everything to factory setting and still won’t work. After searching online, this is a common Canon problem. Nothing but headaches!!
customer_reviews.author: Lora R.

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with printer directly wired
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with printer directly wired. Unable to use wireless because haven't been able to use as both wired and wireless printer at the same time. Used primarily with desktop which is connecter by ethernet on different network than my wireless devices. I would love to be able to use both at same time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These things are built to break down
customer_reviews.text: Just like so many other people, we had this printer for almost 2 years (with light usage) with no issues at all, but then we suddenly get this B203 error that basically means the printer will no longer work and cant be repaired. This is the second Canon model we bought, and the same exact thing happened to the prior model also. Fool me once, shame on you...fool me twice, shame on me; maybe it was a coincidence, but I will not be fooled a third time...I will no long trust buying Canon printers from now on.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is too much hassle, constantly jamming, letters and images misaligned, takes minutes just to do one print job. Do not recommend. Update: Seems as if this model printer is defective. I contacted Canon after this one wouldn't print anymore and they sent me a newer model to replace this one. The newer model works 10 times better. You have a one year warranty with Canon.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: My son calls these disposables printers because they cost as much as refill ink cartridges. Whatever you call it, it was priced right. Set-up was very easy. Simply read and followed the printed instructions... which were clear. I set it up for wi-fi printing from my iPhone. Then I set up my laptop to print via a USB cable. Didn't even need to use the enclosed dvd. I don't print that much. I like being able to copy and scan. Again, not often. Not fast printing, but good quality. I like that it automatically printed on both sides of paper as needed. Will let you know if it drops in my estimation, but I'm happy
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend to others
customer_reviews.text: This printer Is very hard to set up. It will not stay on the network. I have to renter the network passcode every time I turn it on, and most of the time I have to redo it several times. When it finally attaches, it often says there is no paper when there is. Paper jams are very hard to get to to fix. It copies and scans nicely. I have had 3 Canon printers over the years and have loved them, but will not get another one after this one.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Boder

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little printer
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little printer, this is my second one, my other one latest 5 years, until we had a storm. I tried another Cannon printer because, I thought I would upgrade, and print photos I ended up sending it back, it was too large for the area I wanted to place it plus, too many cartridges it takes 4 of the color ones, Which should have been obvious to me. I go through black and white fast enough; I can't imagine the cost to replace 4 color cartridges all the time...I also decided I really liked just keeping my printer simple and basic.....
customer_reviews.author: Honest reviews

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: This printer has had problems since we purchased it. It kept giving us an error message that there was no paper in the tray even though there clearly was. After it prints, it spits the pages all out on the floor. That's when you can even get it to print. We tried contacting the seller who directed us to the manufacturer. We got no response from the manufacturer. I highly advise getting another name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Heather D. Lutz

customer_reviews.title: We are very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: It took about an hour to get everything up. My Mac upstairs found it quicker than my wife's Mac. Take your time in going through the steps and everything will work out fine. Print quality seems fine for us, mostly everyday use. The cost of the ink cartridges is simply outstanding - $11 for the works. We used to pay $80 a month for the ink for the HP. I read many reviews before buying this Canon. I came to the conclusion that you have to spend $200 (at least) to get anything worthwhile. I think my wife has to turn it on every time she wants to use it. Not a big problem really.
customer_reviews.author: David Adams

customer_reviews.title: This printer is very easy to set it
customer_reviews.text: This printer is very easy to set it, prints quickly and color reproduction is great. Very handy to take on site with me to my meetings - portable and not too heavy or bulky. I am happy with this purchase and would recommend it to anyone who needs a reliable yet inexpensive color printer.
customer_reviews.author: Woo Hoo! in Glen Mills

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbage! I used to love canon
customer_reviews.text: Complete garbage! I used to love canon, i constantly get a no paper in tray error, um yes there is paper! Duh i now get a , cant read ink cartridge error! Its official canon ink, right out of the box! So i guess i have to keep buying new ink, even though ink cartridge is 3/4 full? Are u kidding me? Do not buy this lousy printer!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Curious about everything

customer_reviews.title: For 50 bucks; great.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer so far. Love the auto shutoff. Easy to install. The footprint is quite large but if you can put up with that, this printer will not disappoint. My shelf is only 12 inches wide but I put an extra piece of wood extending it outward to support it. Bonus; you can close it up when not in use. Only, you have to open it again to use it. Our old HP always printed out the scan alignment test page wasting ink on every startup. Will update when the real test comes; non OEM cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Moreball

customer_reviews.title: The worst printer I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Excruciatingly slow. I have a brand new iMac, 100 MBPS internet speed, the latest drivers installed, and new ink cartridges. After months of really poor performance, I decided to time how long it took to print a medium sized .jpeg. 3 minutes and 45 seconds. For a blurry and poorly printed image. I've troubleshot everything with this printer and have come to the conclusion that this is just a horrible model. Please save your money and buy something else. This unit will end up in my local dump before the end of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Broadhurst

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute worst piece of garbage I have ever seen. It jams every other page, the wireless feature doesn't work, and since it jams so much and I've had to fight with it so often, a couple of the the flimsy doors and hinges have broken so there is absolutely no hope of ever getting the manufacturer to replace or repair it. I will never buy another Canon Product. T
customer_reviews.author: Tom Moreland

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great printer for the price! Replaced a Canon MG5220 due to a bad printer head. This MG6820 was easy to setup the wireless. Only bad thing about it is that you have to open the paper tray manually when you print - it doesn't open automatically. First World Problems, I know! Otherwise, this prints much faster than my old one and has quality photo printing. Overall, very happy and great value. Would highly recommend for a basic home office or college dorm.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give it zero stars. This is the worst printer ever. It’s soo slow and is constantly malfunctioning. I bought the protection plan and they refused to help me when I first started having issues. Mind you I got this printer in October and started having problems in January. I was just in the middle of printing something and something attached to the ink came off while printing and now my printer completely doesn’t work. I will never ever purchase a printer from canon again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: Many issues with this printer. First, the paper feeder had to be set just right in order for it to identify that there was paper in the tray. This is a constant problem as if it reset itself every time I wanted to print something. It was very slow to turn on and to turn off. Now my biggest problem is the printer claims there is a paper jam and I am unable to retrieve the paper. This is an expensive printer and it has given me issues since the beginning. Definitely not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LouReed

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE NOISY SLOW PAPER FEEDER ISSUES
customer_reviews.text: This printer is THE WORSE printer I have ever owned! Constant problems with recognizing paper is in try. NOISY, SLOW - pure crap! And with all the stupid smarts in it - it cannot even detect the paper that is going in. Hell my HP 813 could handle any paper and that was just dumb printer and I would have today if parallel connection was obsolete. DO NOT BUY - another piece of techno-rubbish. Waste of money - someone out there must be able to make a decent printer without having to blow $400. TERRIBLE.piece of touchy noisy slow junk
customer_reviews.author: Jacu1

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to follow the directions and set up process was ...
customer_reviews.text: I seriously don't know why anyone had issues connecting this printer. It was easy to follow the directions and set up process was over in maybe 15 minutes (I thoight it pretty snazzy that you scan the printed test page and the printer "looks" for evenness..) I have used it a couple of times and it's been just fine! You have to load paper everything if you don't want the paper tray just hanging out, but that's a non-issue for me as I am not a heavy printer at this particular time. Works well!
customer_reviews.author: kellymonster

customer_reviews.title: Works ok ... then error code 1402
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok... nothing great nothing too bad. Then out of blue we got "error code 1402"... something about "printhead." Of course it worked the day before ... just not now. Research on Google suggests that it is basically toast now, nothing reliably fixes this "error" and the cost of a new printhead is more than a new printer. NEVER AGAIN buying a Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Rollo Tomasi

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I cannot begin to convey the level of frustration with this printer. It's incredibly slow and glitchy. The only predictable thing about this printer is that it will consistently malfunction. I don't think I've ever had it just work the way it's supposed to. If you're interested in network errors, freezing up, gobbling whole reams of paper, and simply refusing to print, be sure to buy this one. Without a doubt the most frustrating printer I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Anne

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy set up but the printer I received did not ...
customer_reviews.text: I've always had HP's and decided to try Canon this go round. Big mistake! It was very easy set up but the printer I received did not work. I'm not sure if it got damaged during shipping or if the one I got just so happened to be defective but it ate the paper and caused paper jams every time I tried to print. I couldn't get it to work properly at all so I had to return. Next time I'll be buying my printer from an actual walk-in store
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Setup is impossible
customer_reviews.text: I got it to work initially after a few hours of trial and error, but now that my router fried and reset itself to factory settings, I can't get this printer to change wireless settings. Online, the manual says to insert the setup cd-rom (which it didn't come with). Their online version of the cd-rom says to connect the printer via its usb cable (which it also didn't come with). It worked decently half the time when it did run, but now it's virtually useless. Spend your money to buy the newer model!!
customer_reviews.author: mikek

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been the most frustrating piece of office equipment I’ve ever owned. It is not user friendly, won’t stay connected to WiFi or connect at all sometimes. The USB option is useless so unless you connect via wireless you can’t get it to work. I wish I had kept the box because I would send it back!! It will most likely end up in the garbage eventually, I’m over fighting with it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M Hampton

customer_reviews.title: It's quite annoying but other than that it is a typical great ...
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it a 5 star but it will not connect to my wireless carrier. I can scan from it to my PC using my PC but it will not scan from the menu on the printer itself. It just says it cannot find a wireless connection. It's quite annoying but other than that it is a typical great Canon printer. Great clarity on the printing. I have not printed a photo yet but I'm sure it will be sharp and clear. It also gives a message about the USB port but I can not find a USB plugin any where on the printer.
customer_reviews.author: kimk9885

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware - Printer jams frequently
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these printers for employees at my company and all three have had the same problem. They pull too much paper through the feed and jam so bad that you literally need pliers to pull some of the pieces out. I tried contacting the seller of the printers to return them, but they refused a return as the time limit had expired. The printers were bought in July and August of 2019 and quit working before December. I reached out to Amazon who contacted Canon (supposedly), but I have never heard from Canon either. Don't waste your money. The printer seems like a good deal, but it has a defect.
customer_reviews.author: B. Murch

customer_reviews.title: Terrible - Buy a Hammer Instead and Hit Yourself Repeatedly For Same Experience
customer_reviews.text: What a PIA this thing is! Always has issues. I'm about to buy another printer even though I bought this a few months ago. I though since it was a Canon it would be quality - WRONG. Terrible. UPDATE - Months in and we all still hate this printer. Instead of replacing the ink i'm going to put this thing on the sidewalk. The only problem is someone will take it and have as much trouble as we did and that might not be good for my karma.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Hell

customer_reviews.title: Desirable
customer_reviews.text: Good printer, prints professionally and very easy to use and set up. Fast printer and very good and desirable size
customer_reviews.author: M foley

customer_reviews.title: I hate this printer
customer_reviews.text: I hate this printer. Bought it a year ago and it hasn't performed properly ever since. Wish I'd have returned it. You name what you want out of a printer and this one fails at them all; poor wi-fi, SLOOOOOOW as molasses, shuts off power after 10 minutes rather than go into sleep mode, nothing extraordinary about the prints, regular or photographic, doesn't hold enough paper, and jams all the time. Oh yeah, and drinks up ink. Do NOT buy! Thank God it's nearly Black Friday and I can hopefully get a good deal on a non-Canon printer.
customer_reviews.author: B Have

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to install and never worked from our ipad
customer_reviews.text: This was the worst printer that we have purchased. Most printers these days are so easy to set up and use from the iPad or iPhone. We were only able to use it from our MacBook Air and even then it stopped working after 6 months. We got an error code 5011 and now it won’t go past this regardless of what we try. I’m in the process of contacting Canon and hoping for a decent replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Paddle Girl

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst printer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I tried. Thinking it was my operating inexpertise. Should have returned it. The warm up time is very long and loud. The ink is expensive and does not last. I have never printed a page without at least the first page getting jambed and it is very hard to remove the jambed paper. No access. It's lot larger than I thought (my fault) I don't print often, but over the two years I have had it, I have NEVER printed without some BIG problem. Trash, not even worth giving away. Cause the next person too much disappointment and frustration.
customer_reviews.author: P. George

customer_reviews.title: Uses too much ink.
customer_reviews.text: Blasts through ink. There are 5 cartridges inside. Magenta, cyan, yellow, black and a photo quality grey black one. The photo quality cartridge is used for all printing. So it goes fast. It is the only cartridge in the whole ensemble that Costco cannot refill and it's pretty expensive. The other cartridges Costco does fill, but I was told by their photo center these cartridges are the most expensive ones they fill. I've programmed my computer to default to draft mode to use less ink. But I cannot figure out if there is an option to reduce the photo quality ink used, in order for it to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle N Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Throw Away Technology
customer_reviews.text: I print on average 40 pages/month. After 2 years this machine became a brick. I can not even get it to let me into maintenance mode. Researching it on the Canon website shows that many people had the same experience. My previous Canon printer lasted 2 years as well, but I thought that was a quirk. I bought another since I really don't like HP printers. I will be buying Brother from this point on.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Good ink cartridge life as well
customer_reviews.text: This is the printer/scanner/copier to have. We take this one in our RV with us. If I need to scan anything I can do it wirelessly and keep an electronic copy rather than storing paper. The built in wireless allows you to print or scan without having a wireless network connection. Good ink cartridge life as well. If this one dies I'm going to buy another one just like it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C

customer_reviews.title: This printer prints great and there is a generic ink that is really ...
customer_reviews.text: This printer prints great and there is a generic ink that is really inexpensive compared to the regular brand. It also does a great job scanning. This would be a 5-star printer if the darn thing would just stay connected to my computer through an entire printing process. It's really annoying getting a half printed page and then have to go back and re-print it. Forget about printing a document that is more than 3 or 4 pages, it's just not going to happen. I'm looking for a cord that I can physically connect my laptop to the printer.
customer_reviews.author: MomOf4

customer_reviews.title: I finally gave it away and bought an HP printer which I am very happy with. I think the problem with this printer ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of trouble with the paper feed on this printer. I finally gave it away and bought an HP printer which I am very happy with. I think the problem with this printer is the horizontal paper feed instead of a vertical, gravity-fed paper feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Maine BoyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Canon Customer Service Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: We were happy enough with printer itself - it produced very good quality homework-related documents for my daughter with bright, vivid colors and crisp text. Alas, the printer stopped working after being in relatively light home use for less than two years. This is where Canon came to shine - a call to their customer service resulted in shipping to us a new replacement printer with an extra set of ink cartridges. This level of service contrasts with a typical "if it's over x months you have to 'pay for repairs' attitude from a typical tech manufacturer. I am glad we went with Canon - hopefully the new printer will be more durable though.
customer_reviews.author: Yanik

customer_reviews.title: I would give this 0 stars if I could
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been nothing but trouble since we got it. I would say 9/10 times I try to print something it tells me it's out of paper, which it isn't or the paper gets jammed all the time. It's very frustrating to print anything and have to trouble shoot and load and re-load paper every time. I would not buy this again and I would not advise anyone else buy this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan M.

customer_reviews.title: Worst canon printer I have owned
customer_reviews.text: This looked like an ideal printer to sit on my shelf at home, however using the printer has been a terrible experience. The paper feed tray is constantly not feeding, I have to slightly push the paper to get it to feed. One of the most annoying printers I have ever owned, my frustration has driven me to buy a new printer.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Run Away!
customer_reviews.text: I should have believed the low reviews. What a piece of garbage. The ink is super expensive. It jams all the time and you have to flip the entire thing over to get it. Plus all the parts are like coming off as you do that. Sigh! Worst printer ever!
customer_reviews.author: Eva Latson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Printer - Don't Buy a Canon
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible printer. It won't connect to my wireless network, and it won't print from my Mac using a USB cable. For a while, it would print from some Windows computers, but now it won't print from anything. All I get is communication error 306. I've tried printing from different USB ports. I've tried removing and reinstalling the driver, to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Buecherwurm

customer_reviews.title: Canon Printer Fans
customer_reviews.text: Smooth transition with no issues! We had a previous similar-to Canon Printer which had to be replaced on an emergent basis and I had a drawer full of 271 & 270 toner cartridges, thus we sought the quickest and most reasonable alternative, basically the same printer, but slightly upgraded...Very smooth transition and we opt for Canon over HP, Lexmark etc.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Chase

customer_reviews.title: didn't know it wasn't new
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work fine, but the unit Im replacing looks so much better than the one I just bought. My "new" one is all scratched up and makes a lot of noise. I'm not happy because I think It should say refurbished right up front and can I send you my old one that looks like new to get something back on my purchase? I havent decided whether I will keep this or not.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Bagley

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Would not recognize the factory ink cartridges, so I sent it back Got a better printer with the MG922 which works great. I've had a couple of the Canon printers because of the separate ink cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: AAK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a loyal Canon printer customer for many years. I bought this for my adult daughter and you just can't beat the quality and functionality for the price. She immediately printed CD labels and cards that look professionally done. Trust Canon!
customer_reviews.author: LShrader87

customer_reviews.title: No longer turns on after 1 year of use
customer_reviews.text: Worst printer I’ve ever owned. After one year of use it stopped turning on about a month ago. We took good care of it. Should have gone with an Epson. Most of my pritners have been Epson and they last a good number of years. Unfortunately, I don’t have insurance on it so it’s money down the drain. Do better, Canon!
customer_reviews.author: Noemi

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Looks great and is one of the few home printers that will fit in the area I need it to be placed. Third party ink refills on Amazon help reduce operating cost and are a real value. This is my second Cannon replacing the exact same model that lasted just over two years until continual paper jams caused its demise with what I would term as moderate use. Hoping this one lasts a bit longer...
customer_reviews.author: Punky

customer_reviews.title: Its OK it uses a lot of ink and although ...
customer_reviews.text: Its OK it uses a lot of ink and although you can get after market ink it still adds up. I would not buy again because of ink consumption.
customer_reviews.author: apples

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, view it as a consumable item
customer_reviews.text: After 2.5 years of light use (<10 pages per week) printer head failed. Removed and cleaned per Canon support site, still does not work. Not willing to spend anyore money on it. This is a throwaway item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: easy set up and looks beautiful. only printed one photo so far... it came out lovely. have not used scanner or copier yet, but do not see any problems. would recommend this printer to family and friends.

customer_reviews.title: Won't grab paper
customer_reviews.text: Within a couple of weeks of buying this printer, it won't grab the paper in the tray. I practically have to manually feed each piece of paper into it. It's a nightmare. The manufacturer warranty might cover fixing it, but I guess I would have to pay shipping both ways and obviously that's a huge hassle! I wish I didn't buy this printer.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Prints well, but....
customer_reviews.text: I got a great price ($42) on this, so I shouldn’t complain too much. But can’t say I’d recommend this printer. Definitely high quality prints. However, it eats ink very, very quickly. And the ink is quite expensive, compared to other brands. Also, not easy to wirelessly print whatsoever. I continue to have difficulty printing from my tablet, and we’ve owned it for over 2 yrs. I’d recommend something with Bluetooth, much easier, no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Loving this printer!
customer_reviews.text: My old printer died slowly and painfully - it was getting so I needed a Rosetta Stone to read what ended up on the printed page LOL. Looked at a lot of printers and read tons of reviews and settled on the Canon MG6820 and it's been great!. A little larger than I anticipated but fits nicely on my printer stand and was easy to set up by myself (instructions clear and easy to follow). So far I'm loving this printer after several months of use.
customer_reviews.author: metacathleen

customer_reviews.title: This is a good printer for the price and size
customer_reviews.text: This is a good printer for the price and size. It was very easy to set up, I simply installed the app and was able to print directly from my iPhone within minutes. I rated 4 instead of 5 stars simply because I haven't had to use the other feature of scanning or installing a PC and I have no knowledge of its overall performance.
customer_reviews.author: Devaney S Pitre

customer_reviews.title: It works great- all in one color printer, copier, scanner
customer_reviews.text: I make copies of work documents and I like the printer's reliability and quick response time. A friend suggested I get this one to replace one that I'd had for 10 year. He set it up and installed it for me. I anticipate the cartridges will be pricey to replace, but I'm happy to have a good printer. I have an older laptop, but I understand this printer will be compatible when I purchase a new laptop in the future. I feel like it's a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: triteeindc

customer_reviews.title: It worked very easily after a fairly smooth setup
customer_reviews.text: I won't add to the other more detailed and technical reviews. I just want to say that this was my 4th printer to try and get to print with a new IPad on AirPrint. It worked very easily after a fairly smooth setup, and it continues to work very well. I don't have a laptop or other computer, so I really needed this to work by only using my iPad. I tried 2 HPs and a brother printer, none of them worked. This is a good buy for what I needed. So thankful!
customer_reviews.author: Grammie

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: I've only printed a hand full of times. Got an error message, basically it's a toss unless I want to try to deconstruct it, clean the ink heads, and reassemble. IF thats even the issue. Hate the I just bought new ink for it too. ANyway, I won't be buying this brand of printer again. It shouldn't have had an issues in the short time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Prints streaks after one year
customer_reviews.text: Tried deep cleaning and manual head alginment. It made the problem worse. Now it will not print any black even on test pages. I was hoping it it worked for more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: MojoRisin

customer_reviews.title: Broke After Two Months
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer around two months ago. I got it mainly to print my academic papers for school. I Like Canon since you don't have to buy the 'official ink' for it which saves me a lot of money. However, I am giving 2 stars for the two following reasons; 1. It originally printed very nicely, but now it cuts off and blurs a lot of words/sentences to the point where I can't read them anymore. 2. I've had a lot of paper jam issues; the only way to fix it is to flip the entire printer over and open up the bottom section. 3. I am most likely going to need to buy a new printer.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Terrific and easy!
customer_reviews.text: Could not be happier with this wifi, AirPrint enabled unit. Setup was a breeze, printed instructions clear as a bell. That's really saying something, as technically challenged is a kind description of my abilities. Automatically printed on both sides of the paper, very handy for recipes, etc. Got both my iPhone and iPad connected in no time at all.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brownson

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this printer because it was wireless. However, the quality of this printer is horrible. It can rarely ever recognize that the paper has been fed into it and will say there is no paper, and takes me multiple tries for it to actually read the paper. This happens every single time I print. I also experience a paper jam every time I try to print. Low quality, malfunctions often. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brynne

customer_reviews.title: Good, I like it
customer_reviews.text: Good printing, easy to connect to your wifi router and print from Ipad, pc or android devices. Ordered a set of generic cartridges for 14 bucks, i guess. Double sided print is easy (automatic)
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $188 when I paid $56 in 2017 on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer in Feb 2017 and it has broken down. I don't even use it often. Tried to buy same one and it is now $188 (I paid $56) What a rip off
customer_reviews.author: Wendy P

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this printer. Very easy to set up and use. I love that I can quickly and easily print wirelessly from my computer or phone. Some people said the starter ink set it comes with won't last long, but I print a few times a week and it's lasted nearly a month. Sometimes the ink bleeds a bit but that maybe the fact that I bought some cheaper paper. Very pleased overall.
customer_reviews.author: Anome

customer_reviews.title: Paper jams every time I print
customer_reviews.text: I normally love Canon printers but not this one. Every time I print the paper jams no matter what. I've only had it 2 years but I'm ready to dump it and buy another one. The frustration of not being able to print a page that is black only because one of the color cartridges is out is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Anyone

customer_reviews.title: spits the paper onto the floor and not into the holding tray. Aweful
customer_reviews.text: I cant believe they made the paper holding tray so short it frequently wont catch the printer paper coming out. Every one out of ten sheets gets spit straight out and onto the floor. Then it floats under a cabinet and is a huge pain to retrieve. Canon ruined me. I'll never buy their brand again.
customer_reviews.author: The Mad Inventor

customer_reviews.title: I like the printing performance and ability to use aftermarket inks ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the printing performance and ability to use aftermarket inks with little hassle (compared to HP), but it's WiFi connectivity was a little bit of a nuisance to setup in our household network, and the iAir feature wasn't as seamless as I would have like initially. Also, in retrospect I now wish that it had a paper feed for the scanner, although this desire isn't reflected in its score.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. David L. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: This product is aweful! Was a pain to set ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is aweful! Was a pain to set up and had trouble connecting to the wifi and being recognized my my cromebook, ipad, and desktop (runs on windows). Once we got the darn thing set up it printed photos with faint white lines running through the image. This is the THIRD printer from Cannon that I have do this. I am beyond frustrated with the brand and will never buy their products again.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Reed

customer_reviews.title: Constant paper feed problems.
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrating device... it is rare that paper feed ISN'T an issue. I have to adjust the paper stack constantly. It also jams more often than not. I absolutely do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Wonderland

customer_reviews.title: This printer is so cool!
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer! Love the fact that I can print from my iPad since my computer broke down last week and can't afford a new one for awhile. Was very easy to install and prints lightning fast! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Laurie B

customer_reviews.title: Just wanted to say how much I love this printer
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to say how much I love this printer!! Having had an HP printer with its expensive ink replacement, this printer is perfect!! Its simple to use and the individual ink cartridges make it so easy to know which ink to replace and to do it seamlessly!! Also the cost of the ink is easier on my pocketbook..so Thank you Canon..You have a great printer at a great price!!
customer_reviews.author: mdb

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Broke after a year due to a paper jam. Constant paper jams and very difficult to remove jammed paper. Definitely would not recommend. Uses a ton of ink. Prints super slow. Only think that worked well was AirPrint.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin A

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally review badly but this product is a waste of money and Canon is an unreasonable company. I bought it and in less than a year the printer stopped printing well in color, scanner stopped working etc. I contacted the company several times, send message but nobody even bothered to reply. Not a canon anymore for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ioannis Konstantakopoulos

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE PURCHASE FROM ANOTHER COMPANY
customer_reviews.text: Please save your money. I’ve only used this printer occasionally and this is the message I got today. Now I’ve had issues over the last 3 years but always somewhat resolvable. Called in today about this issue and was told it was unrepairable and cheaper to purchase a new one. Avoid at all costs!
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle G.

customer_reviews.title: missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: This was very disappointing to receive a printer, that was pretty much nothing but a shell. I am a student and we have a small side business. Being able to print at any time day or night is very important. Now, I have to send it back and wait for money to be returned and go somewhere else. I do not recommend !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very good printer
customer_reviews.text: second cannon printer owned. first one lasted 6 years with no issues. replaced due to i wore it out. print quality is excellent and quick. just a little noisy but i can live with it. highly recommended this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Printer at Good Price.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this printer after setting up one for a friend. It replaced a Hewlett Packard that just was too expensive to keep running. This printer is pretty much ideal if you need both black and white and color printing. I use it with my Brother Laser printer for business. For an ink jet printer this is a pleasure to use. It sets up quickly and attaches to the WiFi automatically. It is much faster than my previous ink jet printer and scans easily and well. I recommend this printer highly after using if now for two months.
customer_reviews.author: card

customer_reviews.title: I'm really disappointed. I can't do anything
customer_reviews.text: Did I received defective one? I started to set up ,and after install the ink it said error. How can this happen?! I have to contact support center which close on weekend. Well,I'm really disappointed. I can't do anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: This is a good printer. Hardware installation easy, rest of the set-up not so. Instructions could be improved. I had trouble with wireless connect, went with USB. I have not contacted Canon yet for help. Unit is big and heavy, most printers are. I found print cartridge installation easy. Print quality is good, photo quality average. I needed SD card capability and found this feature very good. It allows viewing color previews of images on small front screen, good feature. I would recommend this printer, good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Mayer

customer_reviews.title: This printer is a piece of crap. It stopped working well with very minimal use
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a piece of crap. It stopped working well with very minimal use, I have checked every possible option to fix it, gone through the manual, viewed online support, cleaned everything and it still doesn't print. I wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Miller

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Awful I Hate It
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible printer. I've been fighting with it for hours just to get it to figure out it actully has paper in the paper feed. Every time it tries to print anything, it takes a half hour to realign some sort of printer feed -- fifteen times ago that should have been lined up and not need to be redone every time, right? Not so much with this machine. Ahhh! I hate it. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: m. adams

customer_reviews.title: Avoid. Problem printer.
customer_reviews.text: After buying this printer on June, 1, 2017 printer decides it can't be discovered by my computer. Needed to print out postage for eBay but nope! I can print from scanning a document but not from the computer. So little after the 1 year warranty ran out it decides to no longer work. Talk about planned obsolescence! Ink is expensive. Also it will use up color cartridges to print black ink. WTF?! Garbage. Junk. Crap. Avoid. Scammed by Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Throws paper out too far after printing. Does not ...
customer_reviews.text: Throws paper out too far after printing. Does not play well with Comcast modem/router. Shuts itself off regularly. Wants updating requiring input rather than automatic over internet. Wants reassurance of paper size all the time
customer_reviews.author: Roger S.

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: do not buy any printer that uses digitally registered ink it is a pain and is overpriced I did no reasearch while looking for a printer to buy and regret it DO NOT DO THE SAME AS ME
customer_reviews.author: Noe

customer_reviews.title: Worked Until it Didn't
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for about six months, then it got "Jam Sickness" - detecting a paper jam that did not exist. Or its haunted. Would not/could not clear the dang fever. Now I'm looking for some Jawas to come buy it for parts.
customer_reviews.author: ohzonejoe

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap. Not the sellers fault - just cheap and ...
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. Not the sellers fault - just cheap and not at all like my old Canon that I loved!
customer_reviews.author: Barbi D

customer_reviews.title: Printer lasted 2.5 years: cheap ink, loud & poor connectivity.
customer_reviews.text: This printer lasted me 2.5 years before dying. The ups: it had decent quality and cheap ink. The downs: it has connectivity issues on my home network, slow printing, loud startup, and the display would always stay on. I think there is a better bang for your buck out there.
customer_reviews.author: klemmuh

customer_reviews.title: It was an OKAY printer, not too bad and not too great.
customer_reviews.text: It was an OKAY printer, not too bad and not too great. It nearly lasted a year for us and now stopped working. When it came to its core function, means the printing part it was kind of slow. Slow printing is good for 3 or 4 papers and when you’ve enough time but when ut comes to more paper printing it was way too slow, but it was working for me as I was using this for homework purposes but not for office use.
customer_reviews.author: Arv

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating AF
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for about a year now and its probably the most frustrating printer I've ever had to endure. I remember the set up being very complicated- and now the issue is even though it's full of paper it likes to alert me that there isn't any. I've done the self cleaning among other things and it still gives me this issue. I have to manually feed the paper in when I want to print.
customer_reviews.author: Desi

customer_reviews.title: Fails to detect paper, constantly. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is complete trash. It constantly fails to detect when there is paper in the slot, even when you follow all the instructions. You cant even load much paper into it, to begin with. So that is also annoying. Its constantly adjusting itself and making loud noises when nothing is even going on. I have had it jam on me multiple times. I have never had any of these problems with any other printers. Its total crap. The only good thing about it is that the scanner works decently. Thats it. Dont buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Burket

customer_reviews.title: Repeated Paper Jams
customer_reviews.text: This printer performed adequately, albeit slowly, for nine months. As mentioned in other reviews, printing a single page can result in a minute long series of whirs and clicks before any printing takes place. The printer lasted just long enough for me to order more ink and then one day it started to jam paper repeatedly. Once the jamming started, I was unable to successfully print at all. Additionally, given the design of the printer, jammed paper is not easily removed. I finally decided to pull the plug and purchase another printer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gabis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate and runs quietly
customer_reviews.text: Very reasonably priced. Set-up went well. Easy to operate and runs quietly. Finding ink seems to be a little more difficult than my old printer ink was and it's a little more expensive. Have been using it for 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: S. D.

customer_reviews.title: It prints...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to replace my MG7521 which died with a B203 fatal error. I must say that this printer, while it prints just fine, is at best a crude replacement for the MG7521: paper-handling is archaic, and it's NOISY! However, it DOES print, and it's not ugly, so there's that...
customer_reviews.author: MarDam

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This printer was much easier to set up than the ts8120. I right this one. The only problem I had was setting up the internet took a little longer, but I got it I also have my cell phone and tablet set up so I can print from any of them.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Ann Palmer

product_meta.title: Canon MG6820 Wireless All-In-One Printer with Scanner and Copier: Mobile and Tablet Printing with Airprint and Google Cloud Print compatible, Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:PrinterWireless All-In-One Printer with Scanner and Copier: Mobile and Tablet Printing with Air print and Google Cloud Print compatible
feature_bullets: Mobile Device Printing: Easily print from your iPhone, iPad, Android or tablet
Powerful Printing options: Air print, Google Cloud Print, Mopria, Canon PRINT app and more
Remarkable print quality with deeper blacks and vivid reds
Print Instagram and Facebook photos directly from smartphone or tablets

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars1,453 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
